bio:treatment.discussion: All sheets that I have seen have aborted seeds. Juncus pervetus was thought to be Juncus subnodulosus, a European native (H. Weimarck 1946). It has been shown that this is a distinct species, however (S. Snogerup and B. Snogerup 1996). It would appear that this species is now extinct.

references.reference: Snogerup, S. and B. Snogerup. 1996. Juncus pervetus Fernald, a misunderstood N. American species. Ann. Naturhist. Mus. Wien, 98 B S98(suppl): 423--426.
Weimarck, H. 1946. Studies in the Juncaceae. With special reference to the species in Ethiopia and the Cape. Svensk . Bot. Tidskr. 40: 141--178.
